release.action: Disabled all tests of UnmarshallerTest as these fail because of Castor problems which need to be fixed there before...
XMLNaming was 'converted' into an interface and the interface was moved.
A bunch of classes that allow to read (interpret) JAXB annotated classes to create Castor class descriptors (that is how Castor holds Java / XML mapping information).
Initial beta release. Supports basic un-/marshalling according to JAXB API but still without interpreting any annotations in the classes.
Introduced JAXBFieldHandlerImpl the generic field handler for JAXB implementations.

The naming classes are now JAXBXmlNaming and JAXBJavaNaming as this is what they do. Provide the Java naming rules or the XML naming rules. As a consequence Java naming is used by ClassInfoBuilder and Xml naming by ClassDescriptorBuilder.
Tests for ClassInfoBuilder, ClassDescriptorBuilder, JAXBFieldHandler, JAXB*Naming, ...
